segment.source: title: App install ads report
segment.target: title: App install ads report

segment.source: ms.assetid: 8C5907A6-8059-4CAF-951F-C97301A5EEDF
segment.target: ms.assetid: 8C5907A6-8059-4CAF-951F-C97301A5EEDF

segment.source: description:
segment.target: description:

segment.source: App install ads report
segment.target: App install ads report

segment.source: There are two ways to get to the App install ads reports page in Dev Center:
segment.target: There are two ways to get to the App install ads reports page in Dev Center:

segment.source: From the left navigation menu on your app's page, click Analytics > App install ads.
segment.target: From the left navigation menu on your app's page, click Analytics > App install ads.

segment.source: From the left navigation menu on your app's page, click Monetization > Promote your app, and then click a campaign's Report link.
segment.target: From the left navigation menu on your app's page, click Monetization > Promote your app, and then click a campaign's Report link.

segment.source: Here you'll see two sections: Ad performance and Account billing history.
segment.target: Here you'll see two sections: Ad performance and Account billing history.

segment.source: Ad performance
segment.target: Ad performance

segment.source: Here, performance metrics are displayed as lines plotted on a graph, with the selected metric on the y-axis and time on the x-axis.
segment.target: Here, performance metrics are displayed as lines plotted on a graph, with the selected metric on the y-axis and time on the x-axis.

segment.source: The default report shows Impressions.
segment.target: The default report shows Impressions.

segment.source: Click the tab headers to view data for other performance metrics.
segment.target: Click the tab headers to view data for other performance metrics.

segment.source: The metrics tracked here are:
segment.target: The metrics tracked here are:

segment.source: Impressions: The number of times your ad has been shown.
segment.target: Impressions: The number of times your ad has been shown.

segment.source: Clicks: The number of times someone clicked on your ad.
segment.target: Clicks: The number of times someone clicked on your ad.

segment.source: Installs: The number of times someone clicked on your ad and then installed your app.
segment.target: Installs: The number of times someone clicked on your ad and then installed your app.

segment.source: See below for more information on install tracking.
segment.target: See below for more information on install tracking.

segment.source: You can display performance data for up to four different ad campaigns at a time.
segment.target: You can display performance data for up to four different ad campaigns at a time.

segment.source: Click More campaigns to choose which campaigns to display.
segment.target: Click More campaigns to choose which campaigns to display.

segment.source: You can also click the minus symbol by a displayed campaign to remove it.
segment.target: You can also click the minus symbol by a displayed campaign to remove it.

segment.source: What is install tracking?
segment.target: What is install tracking?

segment.source: Running an install ad campaign through Promote your app on Dev Center provides much-needed exposure for developers trying to advertise their apps.
segment.target: Running an install ad campaign through Promote your app on Dev Center provides much-needed exposure for developers trying to advertise their apps.

segment.source: Ad impressions are shown to users who are most likely to be interested in the app, and the users click on the ad and install the app from the Store.
segment.target: Ad impressions are shown to users who are most likely to be interested in the app, and the users click on the ad and install the app from the Store.

segment.source: Until today, it was hard to distinguish between installs that were the result of an ad campaign versus installs that came from other sources.
segment.target: Until today, it was hard to distinguish between installs that were the result of an ad campaign versus installs that came from other sources.

segment.source: We have now enabled Install reports for app install campaigns that tell developers how many installs they have earned by running the ad campaign.
segment.target: We have now enabled Install reports for app install campaigns that tell developers how many installs they have earned by running the ad campaign.

segment.source: This only represents downloads that are a direct outcome of the ad campaign, and does not include downloads from other sources.
segment.target: This only represents downloads that are a direct outcome of the ad campaign, and does not include downloads from other sources.

segment.source: By monitoring installs for their ad campaigns, developers can measure the true return on investment from the money spent on promoting their apps.
segment.target: By monitoring installs for their ad campaigns, developers can measure the true return on investment from the money spent on promoting their apps.

segment.source: It also helps in comparing the cost of obtaining a new user with the lifetime value of users.
segment.target: It also helps in comparing the cost of obtaining a new user with the lifetime value of users.

segment.source: How are installs measured?
segment.target: How are installs measured?

segment.source: Promote your app ad campaigns deliver ad impressions within other apps.
segment.target: Promote your app ad campaigns deliver ad impressions within other apps.

segment.source: Users who are exposed to the ad are likely to install the app in one of two ways: by clicking the ad or based on viewing the ad impression.
segment.target: Users who are exposed to the ad are likely to install the app in one of two ways: by clicking the ad or based on viewing the ad impression.

segment.source: If a user is shown an ad and he or she installs the app within 24 hours -- by either clicking the ad, or directly going to the Store page of the app -- that install is attributed to the campaign that delivered the impression.
segment.target: If a user is shown an ad and he or she installs the app within 24 hours -- by either clicking the ad, or directly going to the Store page of the app -- that install is attributed to the campaign that delivered the impression.

segment.source: An install is tracked in the Store -- across phone, tablet, and PC -- based on the user who installed the app.
segment.target: An install is tracked in the Store -- across phone, tablet, and PC -- based on the user who installed the app.

segment.source: The advertising engine tracks users who see the ad and we use this information to correlate the users who viewed the ad with the users who installed the app.
segment.target: The advertising engine tracks users who see the ad and we use this information to correlate the users who viewed the ad with the users who installed the app.

segment.source: In order for the app install to be counted, a few requirements must be met:
segment.target: In order for the app install to be counted, a few requirements must be met:

segment.source: The user has not opted out of targeting.
segment.target: The user has not opted out of targeting.

segment.source: The user is logged in to a Microsoft account.
segment.target: The user is logged in to a Microsoft account.

segment.source: The user meets COPPA requirements (users that don’t meet COPPA requirements cannot be tracked).
segment.target: The user meets COPPA requirements (users that don’t meet COPPA requirements cannot be tracked).

segment.source: As a result, it is possible the app install tracking may underreport the actual number of installs generated by a Promote your app campaign.
segment.target: As a result, it is possible the app install tracking may underreport the actual number of installs generated by a Promote your app campaign.

segment.source: Please note that the total number of downloads for an app is viewable in the Acquisitions report in Dev Center.
segment.target: Please note that the total number of downloads for an app is viewable in the Acquisitions report in Dev Center.

segment.source: Account billing history
segment.target: Account billing history

segment.source: Here you can see all of the transactions associated with your account.
segment.target: Here you can see all of the transactions associated with your account.

segment.source: For each transaction, we show the Transaction date, the appropriate Campaign name, the Payment instrument charged, and the Total amount of the charge.
segment.target: For each transaction, we show the Transaction date, the appropriate Campaign name, the Payment instrument charged, and the Total amount of the charge.

segment.source: Related topics
segment.target: Related topics

source.pc: Create an ad campaign for your app

target.pc: Create an ad campaign for your app
